   121→2. Analyze all staged changes and draft commit message
   122→3. Validate commit message follows conventions (type, scope, subject)
   123→4. Add untracked files, create commit with heredoc format, run `git status` after
   124→5. If pre-commit hook modifies files, verify safety to amend (authorship check, not pushed)
   125→
   126→**PR creation workflow**:
   127→1. Run `git status`, `git diff`, check remote tracking **in parallel**
   128→2. Run `git log` and `git diff [base-branch]...HEAD` to understand full branch history
   129→3. Analyze **all commits** in branch (not just latest)
   130→4. Create PR with format: Summary (1-3 bullets), Test plan (checklist), Claude attribution
   131→5. Session automatically links to PR when created via `gh pr create`
   132→
   133→**Safety protocols**:
   134→- Never update git config
   135→- Never force push to main/master (warn if requested)
   136→- Never skip hooks (--no-verify) unless explicitly requested
   137→- Only amend commits if: (1) user explicitly requested OR (2) adding pre-commit edits
   138→- Always check authorship before amending: `git log -1 --format='%an %ae'`
   139→- Never commit unless explicitly asked
   140→
   141→---
   142→
   143→## PR Review Status Indicator
   144→
   145→**What it is**: Display of pull request review status in the prompt footer showing current branch's PR state
   146→
   147→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   148→
   149→**Key concepts**:
   150→- **Display location**: Clickable PR link in footer (e.g., "PR #446") with colored underline
   151→- **Color meanings**: Green (approved), Yellow (pending review), Red (changes requested), Gray (draft), Purple (merged)
   152→- **Interaction**: Cmd+click (Mac) or Ctrl+click (Windows/Linux) to open PR in browser
   153→- **Auto-update**: Status updates automatically every 60 seconds
   154→- **Requirements**: Requires `gh` CLI installed and authenticated (`gh auth login`)
   155→
   156→---
   157→
   158→## Parallel Execution
   159→
   160→**What it is**: Concurrent execution of multiple independent tool calls or subagents in a single message for efficiency
   161→
   162→**Key concepts**:
   163→- Claude sends multiple independent tool calls in one message when safe to do so
   164→- User can request "run agents in parallel" for concurrent subagent execution
   165→- Each parallel call executes concurrently; all must complete before Claude continues
   166→- Critical constraint: Never parallelize dependent operations (e.g., Read before Edit)
   167→
   168→**Common patterns**:
   169→- **Git pre-commit**: `git status`, `git diff`, `git log` together
   170→- **Multi-file reads**: Several `Read` calls for different files
   171→- **Parallel agents**: `code-reviewer` + `test-runner` simultaneously
   172→- **Codebase search**: Multiple `Grep` with different patterns
   173→
   174→**Constraints**:
   175→- Never use placeholders or guess parameters - wait for actual values
   176→- Sequential dependencies require sequential calls
   177→- Results from all calls needed before continuing
   178→
   179→---
   180→
   181→## Background Agent Support
   182→
   183→**What it is**: Ability for agents to run in the background while you continue working, with asynchronous message passing
   184→
   185→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/sub-agents
   186→
   187→**Key concepts**:
   188→- Agents can now run in background while user continues working
   189→- Agents and bash commands can run asynchronously and send messages to wake up the main agent
   190→- Enables true parallel workflows with human and agent working simultaneously
   191→- Ctrl+B works for both bash commands and agents
   192→- Disable all background task functionality with `CLAUDE_CODE_DISABLE_BACKGROUND_TASKS=1`
   193→- **Pre-launch permissions**: Background agents prompt for tool permissions before launching, reducing mid-execution permission failures
   194→- **MCP tools not available**: Background subagents cannot use MCP tools
   195→
   196→**Expected behavior**:
   197→- Start an agent task that runs in background
   198→- Continue typing/working on other tasks
   199→- Agent can send messages to notify main agent when done
   200→- Results become available when background work completes
   201→
   202→**Use cases**:
   203→- Long-running analysis tasks
   204→- Test suites running while implementing next feature
   205→- Documentation generation in background
   206→- Complex search/exploration while coding
   207→
   208→---
   209→
   210→## Named Sessions
   211→
   212→**What it is**: Ability to name conversation sessions for easier resumption and organization
   213→
   214→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/common-workflows
   215→
   216→**Key concepts**:
   217→- Use `/rename` to name current session
   218→- Use `/resume <name>` in REPL to resume named session
   219→- Use `claude --resume <name>` from terminal to resume
   220→- Use `claude --from-pr <number>` to resume sessions linked to a specific PR
   221→- Makes session management more intuitive than using session IDs
   222→- `/rename` now auto-generates session name from conversation context
   223→
   224→**Workflow examples**:
   225→```bash
   226→# In Claude Code session:
   227→/rename feature-auth-refactor
   228→
   229→# Later, resume from terminal:
   230→claude --resume feature-auth-refactor
   231→
   232→# Or resume from within Claude Code:
   233→/resume feature-auth-refactor
   234→
   235→# Resume session linked to a PR:
   236→claude --from-pr 123
   237→```
   238→
   239→**Benefits**:
   240→- Human-readable session identifiers
   241→- Easy switching between work contexts
   242→- Better organization of related work
   243→- No need to remember cryptic session IDs
   244→
   245→---
   246→
   247→## /stats Command
   248→
   249→**What it is**: Visualize daily usage, session history, streaks, and model preferences
   250→
   251→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   252→
   253→**Key concepts**:
   254→- `/stats` command provides detailed usage statistics
   255→- Shows personal usage patterns and metrics
   256→- Press 'r' to cycle through date ranges (Last 7 days, Last 30 days, All time)
   257→- Includes visual graphs and tracking features
   258→
   259→**Expected metrics**:
   260→- Favorite/most-used model
   261→- Usage over time (graph)
   262→- Usage streak (consecutive days)
   263→- Session history
   264→- Possibly token counts, session counts, etc.
   265→
   266→**Usage**:
   267→```
   268→> /stats
   269→# View statistics, press 'r' to cycle date ranges
   270→```
   271→
   272→---
   273→
   274→## /config Command with Search
   275→
   276→**What it is**: Settings interface with search functionality for finding specific settings
   277→
   278→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   279→
   280→**Key concepts**:
   281→- `/config` opens Settings interface (Config tab)
   282→- Type to search and filter settings
   283→- Makes finding specific settings easier
   284→- Keyword-based filtering of config options
   285→
   286→**Usage**:
   287→```
   288→> /config
   289→# Type to search for settings by name or description
   290→```
   291→
   292→**Expected behavior**:
   293→- Type search terms to filter settings
   294→- Filter visible config options dynamically
   295→- Quick navigation to specific settings
   296→
   297→---
   298→
   299→## /plan Command
   300→
   301→**What it is**: Direct entry into plan mode from the prompt
   302→
   303→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   304→
   305→**Key concepts**:
   306→- Use `/plan` to enter plan mode directly
   307→- Alternative to typing "let's plan" or similar prompts
   308→- Triggers plan mode with all its features (research, questions, structured planning)
   309→- Shortcut for common workflow transition
   310→
   311→**Usage**:
   312→```
   313→> /plan
   314→# Claude enters plan mode and begins gathering requirements
   315→```
   316→
   317→---
   318→
   319→## Remote Session Management
   320→
   321→**What it is**: Commands to manage remote sessions from claude.ai
   322→
   323→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   324→
   325→**Key concepts**:
   326→- `/teleport` - Resume a remote session by ID or open picker (claude.ai subscribers)
   327→- `/remote-env` - Configure remote session environment (claude.ai subscribers)
   328→- Enables seamless transition between web and CLI workflows
   329→- Sessions sync between platforms
   330→
   331→**Workflow**:
   332→1. Start work on claude.ai web interface
   333→2. Use `/teleport` in CLI to resume that session
   334→3. Continue work with full CLI capabilities
   335→4. Changes sync back to web session
   336→
   337→**Benefits**:
   338→- Work continuity across platforms
   339→- Use web for planning, CLI for execution
   340→- Access sessions from anywhere
   341→
   342→---
   343→
   344→## /debug Command
   345→
   346→**What it is**: Command for Claude to help troubleshoot the current session
   347→
   348→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   349→
   350→**Key concepts**:
   351→- Available in interactive mode for session troubleshooting
   352→- Helps Claude analyze current session state and debug issues
   353→- Useful for understanding complex issues or session state problems
   354→- Can include optional description of the issue: `/debug [description]`
   355→
   356→**Expected workflow**:
   357→1. Encounter issue or unusual behavior in session
   358→2. Run `/debug` with optional description
   359→3. Claude reads session debug log and analyzes it
   360→4. Claude suggests fixes or explains the behavior
   361→
   362→---
   363→
   364→## Summarize from Here Feature
   365→
   366→**What it is**: Message selector option to create summaries from selected conversation points
   367→
   368→**Documentation**: https://code.claude.com/docs/en/interactive-mode
   369→
   370→**Key concepts**:
   371→- Available in interactive mode message selector
   372→- Allows creating summaries from specific conversation points
   373→- Useful for extracting relevant context from long conversations
   374→- Can focus on particular message ranges rather than full history
   375→

| agent, subagent, Task tool, delegate, fork, context, agent hooks, SubagentStart, task metrics, token count, duration, tool uses, agent teams, teammate sessions, TeammateIdle, TaskCompleted, sub-agent spawning restrictions | core-features.md | Agents and subagents |
| mcp, server, protocol, tool, mcp server, model context protocol, list_changed, ENABLE_TOOL_SEARCH, tool search, auto MCP | core-features.md, configuration.md | MCP servers and Auto MCP Tool Search |
| plugin, marketplace, install plugin, plugin update, search plugins, filter plugins | core-features.md | Plugins |
| slash command, /command, user-defined command, autocomplete, /plan, /teleport, /remote-env, /rename, /stats, /resume, /todos, /keybindings, /debug | core-features.md, workflows.md | Slash commands |

| release notes, undocumented, new feature, recent | undocumented.md | Undocumented features |
| explore subagent, LSP, desktop, chrome extension, IS_DEMO | undocumented.md | Specific undocumented features |
| token count, metrics, tool uses, duration, Task tool results, task metrics | undocumented.md, core-features.md | Task tool metrics |
| TaskStop, task stopping, background task termination | undocumented.md | TaskStop improvement |
| extended thinking interruption, thinking interrupted, interruption handling | undocumented.md | Extended thinking interruption handling |
| heredoc, delimiter, command smuggling, bash security | undocumented.md | Heredoc security improvement |
| sandbox security, .claude/skills, blocked writes, skill injection | undocumented.md | Blocked writes in sandbox mode |
| claude auth, authentication, login, status, logout, CLI auth | undocumented.md | Claude auth CLI subcommands |
| anchor fragments, @-mentions, file resolution | undocumented.md | File resolution with anchor fragments |
| Windows ARM64, win32-arm64, native binary, ARM processor | undocumented.md | Windows ARM64 native binary support |
| startup performance, performance improvement, schema construction | undocumented.md | Startup performance improvements |
| prompt cache, cache hit rate, optimization, system prompt | undocumented.md | Prompt cache hit rate optimization |
| Opus 4.6 callout, notification, user eligible | undocumented.md | One-time Opus 4.6 callout |
| nested session, guard, launch, Claude Code inside | undocumented.md | Guard against nested sessions |
| observation, discovered, tested, behavior, found that | observations.md | User observations |
| sdk, agent-sdk, behavioral, limitations | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | SDK documentation that explains CLI behavior |
| best practices, effective, failure pattern, verification, validate, verify, explore plan code, prompt crafting, session management, context management, kitchen sink, correction loop, intuition, when to clear | best-practices.md | Effective usage patterns |
| timeout, 60 seconds, canUseTool | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | Tool and callback timeouts |
| permission flow, evaluation order, deny first | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | How permissions are evaluated |
| fork session, forkSession, session branch | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | Session forking behavior |
| checkpoint scope, rewind scope, tracked changes | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | File checkpointing limitations |
| mcp naming, tool naming, mcp__ | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | MCP tool naming convention |
| subagent depth, nested subagent, Task in subagent | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | Subagent spawning constraints |
| streaming mode, single message, image upload | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | Input mode requirements |
| TypeScript-only, Python SDK limitations | sdk-behavioral-bridges.md | SDK platform differences |

## Cross-Theme Questions

Some questions span multiple themes. Load multiple files when keywords match different categories:

- "How do skills work with MCP servers?" -> core-features.md (both topics)
- "Should I use a skill or subagent for this?" -> decision-guide.md + core-features.md
- "What permissions does my MCP server need?" -> core-features.md + configuration.md
- "How do I configure thinking mode?" -> configuration.md + workflows.md
- "What keyboard shortcuts are available?" -> workflows.md
- "How do I customize keyboard shortcuts?" -> workflows.md (Customizable Keyboard Shortcuts section)
- "How do skill hooks work?" -> core-features.md (skills and hooks sections)
- "How does Auto MCP Tool Search work?" -> configuration.md + core-features.md (MCP section)
- "How do I manage tasks?" -> workflows.md (task management system)
- "How do I write effective prompts?" -> best-practices.md
- "When should I use /clear?" -> best-practices.md + workflows.md
- "How do I use Claude in Chrome?" -> integrations.md
- "How do I resume remote sessions?" -> integrations.md (VS Code) + workflows.md
- "How do I add multiple directories?" -> configuration.md (--add-dir flag)
- "How do I resume a session by PR?" -> workflows.md (Named Sessions)
- "What are the latest Claude Code features?" -> undocumented.md
- "What task tools are available?" -> core-features.md (Task Tool section) + workflows.md (Task Management)
- "How do agent teams work?" -> core-features.md (Research Preview Agent Teams)
- "What are the new hooks?" -> core-features.md (Hooks section)
- "How does auto memory work?" -> core-features.md (Automatic Memory Recording)
- "What model options do I have?" -> configuration.md (Model Configuration) + core-features.md

## File Purposes

| File | Primary Use |
|------|-------------|
| `core-features.md` | "How does X work?" for fundamental features |
| `configuration.md` | "How do I configure/customize X?" |
| `integrations.md` | IDE and platform-specific questions |
| `workflows.md` | Productivity and workflow optimization |
| `decision-guide.md` | "Should I use X or Y?" comparisons |
| `undocumented.md` | Features not yet in official docs |
| `observations.md` | User-discovered behaviors |
| `sdk-behavioral-bridges.md` | Behavioral constraints from SDK docs |
| `best-practices.md` | Meta-guidance: when/why to use features, failure patterns |

    90→

    94→- "How do I configure thinking mode?" -> configuration.md + workflows.md
    95→- "What keyboard shortcuts are available?" -> workflows.md

    97→- "How do skill hooks work?" -> core-features.md (skills and hooks sections)

   101→- "When should I use /clear?" -> best-practices.md + workflows.md
   102→- "How do I use Claude in Chrome?" -> integrations.md
   103→- "How do I resume remote sessions?" -> integrations.md (VS Code) + workflows.md
   104→- "How do I add multiple directories?" -> configuration.md (--add-dir flag)
   105→- "How do I resume a session by PR?" -> workflows.md (Named Sessions)
   106→- "What are the latest Claude Code features?" -> undocumented.md
   107→- "What task tools are available?" -> core-features.md (Task Tool section) + workflows.md (Task Management)
   108→- "How do agent teams work?" -> core-features.md (Research Preview Agent Teams)
   109→- "What are the new hooks?" -> core-features.md (Hooks section)
   110→- "How does auto memory work?" -> core-features.md (Automatic Memory Recording)
   111→- "What model options do I have?" -> configuration.md (Model Configuration) + core-features.md
   112→
   113→## File Purposes
   114→
   115→| File | Primary Use |
   116→|------|-------------|
   117→| `core-features.md` | "How does X work?" for fundamental features |
   118→| `configuration.md` | "How do I configure/customize X?" |
   119→| `integrations.md` | IDE and platform-specific questions |
   120→| `workflows.md` | Productivity and workflow optimization |
   121→| `decision-guide.md` | "Should I use X or Y?" comparisons |
   122→| `undocumented.md` | Features not yet in official docs |
   123→| `observations.md` | User-discovered behaviors |
   124→| `sdk-behavioral-bridges.md` | Behavioral constraints from SDK docs |
   125→| `best-practices.md` | Meta-guidance: when/why to use features, failure patterns |
   126→

content.content:
1→# Undocumented Features
     2→
     3→Features mentioned in Claude Code release notes but not yet covered in official documentation. Information is based on release note descriptions and observed behavior. Details may be incomplete or subject to change.
     4→
     5→**Latest Release**: v2.1.42
     6→
     7→---
     8→
     9→## Permission Prompt Feedback
    10→
    11→**What it is**: Ability to provide feedback when accepting permission prompts
    12→
    13→**Introduced**: v2.1.7
    14→
    15→**What we know**:
    16→- Users can now provide feedback when accepting permission prompts
    17→- Helps improve permission system based on user experience
    18→- Likely integrated into permission dialog UI
    19→
    20→**Use cases**:
    21→- Report overly restrictive permissions
    22→- Suggest better permission defaults
    23→- Help Anthropic improve permission UX
    24→
    25→---
    26→
    27→## Agent Final Response in Task Notifications
    28→
    29→**What it is**: Display of agent's final response inline in task completion notifications
    30→
    31→**Introduced**: v2.1.7
    32→
    33→**What we know**:
    34→- Task notifications now show the agent's final response inline
    35→- Provides context without needing to check task details separately
    36→- Improves visibility into what agents accomplished
    37→
    38→**Expected behavior**:
    39→- Background task completes
    40→- Notification shows both completion status and agent's summary
    41→- Reduces need to navigate to task details
    42→
    43→---
    44→
    45→## OAuth/API Console URL Update
    46→
    47→**What it is**: URL change for OAuth and API Console from anthropic.com to platform.claude.com
    48→
    49→**Introduced**: v2.1.7
    50→
    51→**What we know**:
    52→- OAuth and API Console URLs now point to platform.claude.com
    53→- Previously used anthropic.com domain
    54→- Likely part of infrastructure consolidation
    55→
    56→**Updated URLs**:
    57→- OAuth: platform.claude.com/oauth
    58→- API Console: platform.claude.com/console
    59→
    60→---
    61→
    62→## Session URL Attribution in Git
    63→
    64→**What it is**: Automatic attribution of session URLs to commits and PRs from web sessions
    65→
    66→**Introduced**: v2.1.9
    67→
    68→**What we know**:
    69→- Web sessions now add session URL attribution to commits and PRs
    70→- Helps trace git activity back to originating web session
    71→- Improves audit trail for web-based workflows
    72→
    73→**Expected format**:
    74→- Commit/PR includes URL to originating claude.ai session
    75→- Enables jumping from git history to conversation context
    76→
    77→---
    78→
    79→## Copy OAuth URL Keyboard Shortcut
    80→
    81→**What it is**: Keyboard shortcut 'c' to copy OAuth URL when browser doesn't open during login
    82→
    83→**Introduced**: v2.1.10
    84→
    85→**What we know**:
    86→- Press 'c' to copy OAuth URL to clipboard during login
    87→- Useful when browser auto-open fails
    88→- Improves login experience in restricted environments
    89→
    90→**Expected workflow**:
    91→1. Start login process
    92→2. Browser fails to open automatically
    93→3. Press 'c' to copy URL to clipboard
    94→4. Paste URL manually in browser
    95→
    96→---
    97→
    98→## Trust Warning for Plugin Installation in VSCode
    99→
   100→**What it is**: Warning dialog when installing plugins via VSCode extension
   101→
   102→**Introduced**: v2.1.10
   103→
   104→**What we know**:
   105→- VSCode extension shows trust warning before plugin installation
   106→- Improves security awareness when adding third-party plugins
   107→- Aligns with VSCode security best practices
   108→
   109→---
   110→
   111→## Startup Keystroke Capture Improvement
   112→
   113→**What it is**: Enhanced startup to capture keystrokes before REPL is fully ready
   114→
   115→**Introduced**: v2.1.10
   116→
   117→**What we know**:
   118→- Startup improved to capture keystrokes earlier
   119→- Prevents lost input during Claude Code initialization
   120→- Improves responsiveness during startup phase
   121→
   122→**Benefits**:
   123→- No need to wait for full REPL readiness before typing
   124→- Faster perceived startup time
   125→- Better user experience for quick commands
   126→
   127→---
   128→
   129→## File Suggestions as Removable Attachments
   130→
   131→**What it is**: Enhanced display of file suggestions as removable attachments in the UI
   132→
   133→**Introduced**: v2.1.10
   134→
   135→**What we know**:
   136→- File suggestions now display as removable attachments
   137→- Improves clarity of which files are included in context
   138→- Allows easy removal before sending prompt
   139→
   140→**Expected behavior**:
   141→- Suggest files with @-mention
   142→- Files appear as attachment chips
   143→- Click to remove unwanted suggestions before submit
   144→
   145→---
   146→
   147→## Per-User Temp Directory Isolation
   148→
   149→**What it is**: Isolated temporary directories for each user to prevent permission conflicts
   150→
   151→**Introduced**: v2.1.23
   152→
   153→**What we know**:
   154→- Fixed per-user temp directory isolation preventing permission conflicts on shared systems
   155→- Each user gets their own isolated temp directory
   156→- Prevents conflicts when multiple users run Claude Code on same system
   157→
   158→---
   159→
   160→## TaskStop tool result improvement
   161→
   162→**What it is**: Improved TaskStop tool to display the stopped command/task description in the result line instead of a generic 'Task stopped' message
   163→
   164→**Introduced**: v2.1.30
   165→
   166→**What we know**:
   167→- TaskStop results now show the specific task that was stopped
   168→- Provides better feedback about which background task was terminated
   169→- Clearer output when managing multiple background tasks
   170→
   171→---
   172→
   173→## Summarize from Here Feature
   174→
   175→**What it is**: Added 'Summarize from here' option to the message selector for creating summaries from selected points
   176→
   177→**Introduced**: v2.1.32
   178→
   179→**What we know**:
   180→- Available in interactive mode message selector
   181→- Allows creating summaries from specific conversation points
   182→- Useful for extracting relevant context from long conversations
   183→
   184→---
   185→
   186→## Extended Thinking Interruption Handling
   187→
   188→**What it is**: Improved handling for extended thinking interruption
   189→
   190→**Introduced**: v2.1.33
   191→
   192→**What we know**:
   193→- Improved robustness when extended thinking is interrupted
   194→- Better error handling during thinking phase
   195→- More graceful fallback to standard reasoning
   196→
   197→---
   198→
   199→## Heredoc Delimiter Parsing Security Improvement
   200→
   201→**What it is**: Improved heredoc delimiter parsing to prevent command smuggling
   202→
   203→**Introduced**: v2.1.38
   204→
   205→**What we know**:
   206→- Enhanced security in bash command parsing
   207→- Prevents potential command injection via heredoc delimiters
   208→- Protects against sophisticated shell command attacks
   209→
   210→---
   211→
   212→## Blocked Writes to .claude/skills in Sandbox Mode
   213→
   214→**What it is**: Blocked writes to .claude/skills directory in sandbox mode for security
   215→
   216→**Introduced**: v2.1.38
   217→
   218→**What we know**:
   219→- Sandbox mode now prevents writing to .claude/skills directory
   220→- Prevents potential skill injection attacks from sandboxed code
   221→- Improves security isolation in sandboxed environments
   222→
   223→---
   224→
   225→## Claude Auth Login/Status/Logout CLI Subcommands
   226→
   227→**What it is**: New CLI subcommands for authentication: claude auth login, claude auth status, and claude auth logout
   228→
   229→**Introduced**: v2.1.41
   230→
   231→**What we know**:
   232→- Three new authentication-related commands added to CLI
   233→- Allows authentication management from terminal directly
   234→- Provides status checking and explicit logout capability
   235→
   236→**Available commands**:
   237→- `claude auth login` - Authenticate with Claude Code
   238→- `claude auth status` - Check current authentication status
   239→- `claude auth logout` - Logout from current session
   240→
   241→---
   242→
   243→## File Resolution for @-mentions with Anchor Fragments
   244→
   245→**What it is**: Improvements to file resolution for @-mentions with anchor fragments
   246→
   247→**Introduced**: v2.1.41
   248→
   249→**What we know**:
   250→- Enhanced resolution of @-mentions when using anchor fragments
   251→- Allows more precise file and location references
   252→- Improves file suggestion accuracy
   253→
   254→---
   255→
   256→## Windows ARM64 Native Binary Support
   257→
   258→**What it is**: Added Windows ARM64 (win32-arm64) native binary support
   259→
   260→**Introduced**: v2.1.41
   261→
   262→**What we know**:
   263→- Native binary support for Windows running on ARM64 processors
   264→- Previously required emulation on ARM-based Windows systems
   265→- Improves performance on modern ARM-based Windows devices
   266→
   267→---
   268→
   269→## Startup Performance Improvements
   270→
   271→**What it is**: Improved startup performance by deferring Zod schema construction
   272→
   273→**Introduced**: v2.1.42
   274→
   275→**What we know**:
   276→- Startup process optimized with deferred schema validation
   277→- Reduces initialization time for sessions
   278→- Particularly beneficial for frequently-started sessions
   279→
   280→---
   281→
   282→## Prompt Cache Hit Rate Optimization
   283→
   284→**What it is**: Improved prompt cache hit rates by moving date out of system prompt
   285→
   286→**Introduced**: v2.1.42
   287→
   288→**What we know**:
   289→- System prompt refactored to improve cache efficiency
   290→- Date moved to user context instead of system prompt
   291→- Increases cache hit rates and reduces API costs
   292→- Results in better token usage for sessions
   293→
   294→---
   295→
   296→## One-time Opus 4.6 Callout for Eligible Users
   297→
   298→**What it is**: One-time Opus 4.6 callout for eligible users
   299→
   300→**Introduced**: v2.1.42
   301→
   302→**What we know**:
   303→- One-time notification for users eligible to use Opus 4.6
   304→- Appears in Claude Code when user qualifies
   305→- Informs users about new model availability
   306→
   307→---
   308→
   309→## Guard Against Launching Claude Code Inside Another Session
   310→
   311→**What it is**: Added guard against launching Claude Code inside another Claude Code session
   312→
   313→**Introduced**: v2.1.41
   314→
   315→**What we know**:
   316→- Detects when Claude Code is launched from within another Claude Code session
   317→- Prevents accidental nested session launch
   318→- Shows warning or error to prevent user confusion
   319→

    87→## Cross-Theme Questions
    88→
    89→Some questions span multiple themes. Load multiple files when keywords match different categories:
    90→
    91→- "How do skills work with MCP servers?" -> core-features.md (both topics)
    92→- "Should I use a skill or subagent for this?" -> decision-guide.md + core-features.md
    93→- "What permissions does my MCP server need?" -> core-features.md + configuration.md
    94→- "How do I configure thinking mode?" -> configuration.md + workflows.md
    95→- "What keyboard shortcuts are available?" -> workflows.md
    96→- "How do I customize keyboard shortcuts?" -> workflows.md (Customizable Keyboard Shortcuts section)
    97→- "How do skill hooks work?" -> core-features.md (skills and hooks sections)
    98→- "How does Auto MCP Tool Search work?" -> configuration.md + core-features.md (MCP section)
    99→- "How do I manage tasks?" -> workflows.md (task management system)
   100→- "How do I write effective prompts?" -> best-practices.md
   101→- "When should I use /clear?" -> best-practices.md + workflows.md
   102→- "How do I use Claude in Chrome?" -> integrations.md
   103→- "How do I resume remote sessions?" -> integrations.md (VS Code) + workflows.md
   104→- "How do I add multiple directories?" -> configuration.md (--add-dir flag)
   105→- "How do I resume a session by PR?" -> workflows.md (Named Sessions)
   106→- "What are the latest Claude Code features?" -> undocumented.md
   107→- "What task tools are available?" -> core-features.md (Task Tool section) + workflows.md (Task Management)
   108→- "How do agent teams work?" -> core-features.md (Research Preview Agent Teams)
   109→- "What are the new hooks?" -> core-features.md (Hooks section)
   110→- "How does auto memory work?" -> core-features.md (Automatic Memory Recording)
   111→- "What model options do I have?" -> configuration.md (Model Configuration) + core-features.md
   112→
   113→## File Purposes
   114→
   115→| File | Primary Use |
   116→|------|-------------|
   117→| `core-features.md` | "How does X work?" for fundamental features |
   118→| `configuration.md` | "How do I configure/customize X?" |
   119→| `integrations.md` | IDE and platform-specific questions |
   120→| `workflows.md` | Productivity and workflow optimization |
   121→| `decision-guide.md` | "Should I use X or Y?" comparisons |
   122→| `undocumented.md` | Features not yet in official docs |
   123→| `observations.md` | User-discovered behaviors |
   124→| `sdk-behavioral-bridges.md` | Behavioral constraints from SDK docs |
   125→| `best-practices.md` | Meta-guidance: when/why to use features, failure patterns |
   126→

message.content: After we commit these changes, yes. In the meantime, anything particularly noteworthy? I haven't been keeping up

content.thinking: The user wants to know what's noteworthy from the new features discovered in the v2.1.32-v2.1.42 range. Let me highlight the most significant ones.

content.text:
A few standout additions since v2.1.31:

**Agent Teams** (v2.1.32) is probably the biggest one - multi-agent collaboration where one Claude session acts as a team lead, coordinating multiple Claude Code instances working in parallel. It runs in tmux or iTerm2 split panes so you can watch them all work. Two new hook events (`TeammateIdle`, `TaskCompleted`) came with it in v2.1.33 for enforcing quality gates on teammates.

**Auto Memory** (v2.1.32) - Claude now automatically records and recalls learnings across sessions (you're already using this - the `memory/` directory in your project). Agents can also get persistent memory with configurable scope (user, project, or local) via a `memory` field in their frontmatter.

**Sub-agent spawning restrictions** (v2.1.33) - You can now use `Task(agent_type)` syntax in the `tools` field to restrict which sub-agents an agent can spawn. Useful for tighter control in your plugin agents.

**Fast mode for Opus 4.6** (v2.1.36) - `/fast` now works with Opus 4.6, same model but faster output. That's what the system prompt references about toggling it.

**Skills auto-load from nested directories** (v2.1.32) and **skill character budget scaling** (2% of context window) are nice quality-of-life improvements for your plugin work specifically.

The security-oriented ones are worth noting too: heredoc delimiter parsing to prevent command smuggling, and blocked writes to `.claude/skills` in sandbox mode.

Want me to go ahead and commit these changes now?

message.content: Wait, are you saying subagents can spawn subagents now?

content.thinking:
The user is asking about sub-agent spawning. Let me re-read what the feature actually says. The feature is "Sub-agent Spawning Restrictions with Task(agent_type)" - the key word is "restrictions." The parser excerpt says:

"When an agent runs as the main thread with `claude --agent`, it can spawn subagents using the Task tool. To restrict which subagent types it can spawn, use `Task(agent_type)` syntax in the `tools` field"

So this is about agents that run as the main thread (via `claude --agent`) being able to spawn subagents, and the new feature is the ability to *restrict* which types they can spawn. 

The spawning capability itself isn't new—what's changed is the ability to control which agent types can be spawned through the Task tool syntax. I'm uncertain whether nested subagents can spawn their own subagents, since the feature description specifically focuses on main-thread agents.

content.text:
Good question - I may have described that imprecisely. Let me re-read what the parser found.

The excerpt from the docs says:

> "When an agent runs as **the main thread** with `claude --agent`, it can spawn subagents using the Task tool. To restrict which subagent types it can spawn, use `Task(agent_type)` syntax in the `tools` field"

So this is about agents running as the **main thread** (via `claude --agent`), not subagents spawning subagents. The new part is the restriction mechanism - you can now control *which* sub-agent types a main-thread agent is allowed to spawn using `Task(agent_type)` in the `tools` field.

For example, you could write an agent that's only allowed to spawn `test-runner` and `commit-creator` but nothing else. That's useful for keeping agents scoped to their purpose.

I don't have confident information on whether nested sub-agent spawning (a subagent launching its own subagents) is supported. The docs excerpt specifically scopes it to main-thread agents. Sorry for the misleading summary.

message.content: got it, Go ahead and commit the update. I think that we can clear the cache though before committing.
